dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.description: System status and domain routing checker
dashboard.configurationOutdated: Configuration has been modified. Restart keen-pbr service to apply changes.
dashboard.dnsmasqConfigurationOutdated: Dnsmasq configuration is outdated. Restart dnsmasq service to apply changes.
dashboard.dnsmasqNotConfigured: Dnsmasq is not configured to read keen-pbr config. Run: keen-pbr print-dnsmasq-config > /opt/etc/dnsmasq.d/keen-pbr.conf && /opt/etc/init.d/S56dnsmasq restart
dashboard.configurationOutdatedBoth: Configuration has been modified. Restart both keen-pbr and dnsmasq services to apply changes.

domainChecker.title: Domain/IP Routing Checker
domainChecker.placeholderNote: Note: This is a placeholder. API integration is pending.
domainChecker.notFoundInRules: Host was not found in any rules

selfCheck.title: Configuration Self-Check
selfCheck.description: Validate your configuration and verify that iptables, ip rules, ip routes, and ipsets are correctly configured
selfCheck.noResults: No results yet. Click 'Run Self-Check' to start validation.

dnsCheck.title: DNS Check
dnsCheck.description: Verify that split-DNS is configured correctly
dnsCheck.browserFail: Seems DNS in your browser is misconfigured
dnsCheck.pcCheckDescription: Run the following command in your terminal to check DNS configuration:
dnsCheck.pcCheckTimeout: If you already ran this command, seems your DNS on PC is misconfigured. Make sure that your router is configured as primary DNS server.
dnsCheck.pcSuccess: DNS on PC is working, but on browser is not. Maybe you have some VPN plugin installed in your browser or use Edge Secure Network or Cloudflare DNS-over-HTTPS in Firefox?

settings.title: General Settings
settings.description: Manage global configuration settings for keen-pbr
settings.listsOutputDirDescription: Directory where downloaded list files will be stored
settings.useKeeneticDnsDescription: Use Keenetic DNS from System profile as upstream in generated dnsmasq config
settings.fallbackDnsDescription: Fallback DNS server to use if Keenetic RCI call fails (e.g., 8.8.8.8 or 1.1.1.1). Leave empty to disable.
settings.autoUpdateListsDescription: Automatically download and update lists with URLs in background (default: enabled)
settings.updateIntervalHoursDescription: Interval in hours for automatic list updates (minimum: 1 hour, default: 24 hours)
settings.enableInterfaceMonitoringDescription: Enable keen-pbr service to monitor interface state changes and automatically reapply routing (checks every 10 seconds)

empty.title: No lists found
empty.description: Create your first list to get started

download.unchanged: List "{{name}}" is up to date (no changes)

dialog.createDescription: Create a new list of domains, IPs, or CIDRs
dialog.listNameDescription: A unique name for this list
dialog.listTypeDescription: Where the list data comes from
dialog.urlDescription: HTTP(S) URL to download the list from
dialog.filePathDescription: Absolute path to the list file on the system
dialog.validationError: Please fix validation errors before saving
dialog.validationErrors: {{count}} validation error found. Please fix errors before saving.
dialog.validationErrors_plural: {{count}} validation errors found. Please fix errors before saving.

delete.title: Delete List
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete the list "{{name}}"?
delete.warningMessage: This list is referenced by the following IPSets:
delete.warningInstruction: You must remove these references before deleting this list.
delete.confirmation: This action cannot be undone. The list configuration will be permanently deleted.

routingRules.title: Routing Rules
routingRules.description: Manage IPSet routing configurations for policy-based routing

empty.title: No routing rules found
empty.description: Create your first routing rule to get started

dialog.createDescription: Create a new routing rule for policy-based routing
dialog.selectListsDescription: Choose which lists to include in this routing rule
dialog.interfacesDescription: Add interfaces in priority order (first = highest priority)
dialog.advancedRoutingDescription: Configure priority, table, and fwmark. Leave empty to auto-assign values (500-1000 range).
dialog.defaultGatewayDescription: Gateway IP address to use when no interface is available. Must match IP version (IPv4 for IPv4, IPv6 for IPv6).
dialog.killSwitch: Kill switch (block traffic when all interfaces are down)
dialog.selectListsError: At least one list must be selected
dialog.selectInterfacesError: At least one interface must be specified

emptyLists.title: No lists selected
emptyLists.description: Click "Add list" above to select at least one list for this routing rule.

emptyInterfaces.title: No interfaces selected
emptyInterfaces.description: Click "Add interface" above to select interfaces for routing (optional).

delete.title: Delete Routing Rule
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete the routing rule "{{name}}"? This action cannot be undone and will remove all associated IPSet and routing configurations.
